# CRGE Historical Database

Welcome to the English version of the **CRGE Historical Database**, a comprehensive resource documenting Christian missionary history and religious agency in East Asia.

## About This Database

This digital archive contains extensive documentation of Christian missionary activities, religious movements, and cultural interactions across East Asian regions including China, Korea, Japan, Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Manchuria. The content spans from the late 19th century through the modern era, offering insights into the complex relationships between Christianity and local societies.

## Database Overview

```{r}
#| label: database_stats
#| results: asis
#| echo: false

# Calculate basic statistics
total_entries <- nrow(df)
total_areas <- length(unique(df$area[!is.na(df$area) & df$area != ""]))
total_periods <- length(unique(df$period[!is.na(df$period) & df$period != ""]))
total_topics <- length(unique(df$topic[!is.na(df$topic) & df$topic != ""]))

# Count entries with English content
entries_with_content <- df %>%
  filter(!is.na(text_en), nzchar(text_en)) %>%
  nrow()

cat(glue("- **Total Database Entries:** {format(total_entries, big.mark = ',')}\n"))
cat(glue("- **Geographic Areas:** {total_areas}\n"))
cat(glue("- **Time Periods:** {total_periods}\n"))
cat(glue("- **Topics Covered:** {total_topics}\n"))
cat(glue("- **Entries with English Content:** {format(entries_with_content, big.mark = ',')}\n\n"))
```

## Geographic Coverage

```{r}
#| label: geographic_breakdown
#| results: asis
#| echo: false

# Get breakdown by area
area_stats <- df %>%
  filter(!is.na(area), area != "") %>%
  group_by(area) %>%
  summarise(
    total_entries = n(),
    periods = n_distinct(period[!is.na(period) & period != ""]),
    with_english = sum(!is.na(text_en) & nzchar(text_en)),
    .groups = 'drop'
  ) %>%
  arrange(desc(total_entries))

for (i in 1:nrow(area_stats)) {
  area <- area_stats$area[i]
  total <- area_stats$total_entries[i]
  periods <- area_stats$periods[i]
  english <- area_stats$with_english[i]
  
  cat(glue("**{area}:** {format(total, big.mark = ',')} entries across {periods} time periods ({format(english, big.mark = ',')} with English content)\n\n"))
}
```

## Content Organization

Each regional section is organized by:

- **Agency** (Religious actors and movements)
  - Christian or Pro-Christian Leaders
  - Christian or Pro-Christian Organizations
  - Christian or Pro-Christian Events/Movements
  - Key Theological Issues
  - Anti-Christian Leaders
  - Anti-Christian Organizations
  - Anti-Christian Events/Movements
  - Bibliography

- **Context** (Historical background)
  - Governmental Regulations on Religion
  - Social Hostility toward Christianity
  - Geopolitical Dynamics
  - Bibliography

## Sample Content

```{r}
#| label: sample_content
#| results: asis
#| echo: false

# Show a sample entry
sample_entry <- df %>%
  filter(!is.na(text_en), nzchar(text_en), 
         !is.na(area), !is.na(period), !is.na(topic), !is.na(section)) %>%
  slice(1)

if (nrow(sample_entry) > 0) {
  area <- sample_entry$area[1]
  period <- sample_entry$period[1]
  topic <- sample_entry$topic[1]
  section <- sample_entry$section[1]
  text <- sample_entry$text_en[1]
  
  # Truncate text if too long
  if (nchar(text) > 300) {
    text <- paste0(substr(text, 1, 300), "...")
  }
  
  cat(glue("Here's an example entry from **{area} ({period})** under the topic **{topic}**, section **{section}**:\n\n"))
  cat(glue("> {text}\n\n"))
}
```
